Comment: This is up to the US Supreme Court in the sense that their opinion is legally controlling, but controlling is not the same as *correct*.   The US Supreme Court can make, has made, and still *does* make incorrect decisions. It is a fallible institution. Suggesting otherwise is absurd, especially in connection with an action where three justices disagreed.
